title: Calmer RTL track-title marquee motion (slower + loop pause)

requirements.summary: Tune the RTL track title marquee to be slightly slower and add a subtle pause at the loop boundary while preserving overflow-only behavior, reduced-motion disablement, and existing pause/resume interactions on Mini Player and Now Playing.
acceptanceCriteria: On both the Mini Player and Now Playing screen, long track titles still scroll right-to-left only when they overflow their container.
The marquee scroll speed is noticeably slightly slower than the current default (no sudden jumps, no stutter).
There is a small, perceptible pause at the repeat point (loop boundary) so the motion feels calmer, without breaking the seamless duplicate-text marquee effect.
The existing pause/resume interactions (pointer down/up, keyboard focus + Space/Enter) continue to work as before.
If the OS/browser has prefers-reduced-motion enabled, the title does not animate (same as current behavior).

file_operations.description: Lower the default marquee speed (speedPxPerSecond) so the default motion feels less aggressive, while keeping the existing interaction-based pause/resume logic and prefers-reduced-motion gating intact.

Adjust marquee timing calculations to align with the calmer default speed and to account for a loop-boundary pause (e.g., by slightly increasing computed duration and/or introducing a pause-friendly duration model) without changing overflow detection behavior.

Update the marquee RTL keyframes to include a subtle dwell at the start/end positions (loop boundary) while keeping movement segments smooth and continuous; preserve the existing prefers-reduced-motion CSS override for disabling animation.
